subject: Education
title: Intrinsic Motivation Across Cultures
description: A 60-second lesson on Intrinsic Motivation Across Cultures.

hook.text: American students thrive with personal choice. Some Asian students thrive when a trusted adult chooses for them.

buildup.text: Early self-determination research was done mostly in Western, individualist cultures.

discovery.text: In collectivist cultures, autonomy can mean alignment with family values, not rebellion.

twist.text: Choice overload harms motivation everywhereâ€”thirty-two flavors freeze people in every culture.

climax.text: The core needs are universal; the ways they are satisfied vary across cultural contexts.

punchline.text: Motivation is universal. The recipe for it is local.

quiz.question: How does culture influence intrinsic motivation?
options: The core needs are universal but the ways they are met vary by culture
Only Western students experience intrinsic motivation
Cultural differences in motivation do not exist
